article_text:
Inflation might be tame, but it still is going to affect your taxes next year.

The Internal Revenue Service won't release the official numbers for inflation adjustments to tax-code provisions affecting individuals in 2014 until later this year. But some experts have released their own projections.

James Young, the Crowe Horwath professor of accountancy at Northern Illinois University, and specialists at tax publisher CCH, a...

twitter.description: Forecasting next year's IRS inflation adjustments, which affect everything from tax brackets to personal exemptions to gift and estate taxes.
twitter.creator: @SaundersWSJ
twitter.title: A Sneak Peek at 2014 Taxes
